item.title: Kate add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "They spent the first three years of school getting you to pretend stuff and then the rest of it marking you down if you did the same thing." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Kate add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Everybody likes to have a place to think, to meditate, to eat a burrito..." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Kate add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it. Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Kate add a quote by Francine Prose
item.description: "People see everything through the lens of their obsessions." -- Francine Prose

item.title: Kate add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Kate add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "Where I'm from, we believe in all sorts of things that aren't true... we call it history." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Kate add a quote by Tom Perrotta
item.description: "After all, what was adult life but one moment of weakness piled on top of another? Most people just fell in line like obedient little children, doing exactly what society expected of them at any given moment, all the while pretending that they’d actually made some sort of choice." -- Tom Perrotta

item.title: Kate add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "There's something to be said for hunger: at least it lets you know you're still alive." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Kate add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Kate add a quote by Francine Prose
item.description: "We never believe we're beautiful, no matter how many times we hear it. We never believe it until someone says it in the right way." -- Francine Prose

item.title: Kate add a quote by Francine Prose
item.description: "What I love is how pissed off Jane Eyre is. She's in a rage for the whole novel and the payoff is she gets to marry this blind guy who's toasted his wife in the attic." -Angela Argo "Blue Angel" -- Francine Prose

item.title: Kate add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "We do know that no one gets wise enough to really understand the heart of another, though it is the task of our life to try." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Kate add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I wanted to tell the book thief many things, about beauty and brutality. But what could I tell her about those things that she didn't already know? I wanted to explain that I am constantly overestimating and underestimating the human race-that rarely do I ever simply estimate it. I wanted to ask her how the same thing could be so ugly and so glorious, and its words and stories so damning and brilliant." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Kate add a quote by Marcus Zusak
item.description: "People observe the colors of a day only at its beginnings and ends, but to me it's quite clear that a day merges through a multitude of shades and intonations with each passing moment. A single hour can consist of thousands of different colors. Waxy yellows, cloud-spot blues. Murky darkness. In my line of work, I make it a point to notice them." -- Marcus Zusak

item.title: Kate add a quote by Kelly Gallagher
item.description: "...Shouldn't schools be the place where students interact with interesting books? Shouldn't the faculty have an ongoing laser-like commitment to put good books in our students' hands? Shouldn't this be a front-burner issue at all times?" -- Kelly Gallagher

item.title: Kate add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kate add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Kate add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description:
"But Anatole said suddenly, 'Don't expect God's protection in places beyond God's dominion. It will only make you feel punished. I'm warning you. When things go bad, you will blame yourself.'
'What are you telling me?'
'I am telling you what I'm telling you. Don't try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you are good, bad things can still happen. And if you are bad, you can still be lucky." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Kate add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Everything you're sure is right can be wrong in another place. " -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Kate add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "It's what you do that makes your soul." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Kate add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Cooking is 80 percent confidence, a skill best acquired starting from when the apron strings wrap around you twice." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Kate add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "It is perfectly true, as philosophers say, that life must be understood backwards. But they forget the other proposition, that it must be lived forwards." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Kate add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "Show me a man with a tattoo and I'll show you a man with an interesting past." -- Jack London

item.title: Kate add a quote by Robin McKinley
item.description: "I don't put up with being messed around, and I don't suffer fools gladly. The short version of that is that I'm a bitch. Trust me, I can provide character references." -- Robin McKinley

item.title: Kate add a quote by Sena Jeter Naslund
item.description: "Great minds may have cold hearts. Form but no color. It is an incompleteness. And so they are afraid of any woman who both thinks and feels deeply." -- Sena Jeter Naslund

item.title: Kate add a quote by P.D. James
item.description: "Not so much two ships passing in the night as two ships sailing together for a time but always bound for different ports." -- P.D. James

item.title: Kate add a quote by P.D. James
item.description: "Feel, he told himself, feel, feel, feel. Even if what you feel is pain, only let yourself feel." -- P.D. James

item.title: Kate add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kate add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Kate add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Description begins in the writer’s imagination, but should finish in the reader’s." -- Stephen King
